BARBED WIRE.Defintion: wire with clusters of short, sharp spikes, used to make fences or in warfare as an obstruction

BRIBE.Defintion: dishonestly persuade (someone) to act in one's favour by a gift of money or other inducement

BRUTE.Defintion: merely physical - 'brute' is typically used before 'force' to emphasis the physicality of the force

CULT.Defintion: a person or thing that is popular or fashionable among a particular group or section of society

DUMMIES.Defintion: a model or replica of a human being

EXTRADITED.Defintion: hand over (a person accused or convicted of a crime) to a foreign state in which the crime was committed

FEAT.Defintion: an achievement that requires great courage, skill, or strength

IMPLICATED.Defintion: show (someone) to be involved in a crime

INGENIOUS.Defintion: (of a machine or idea) cleverly and originally devised and well suited to its purpose

INTRIGUING.Defintion: arousing one's curiosity or interest; fascinating

LURED.Defintion: tricked into coming into a place

NOTORIOUS.Defintion: famous or well known, typically for some bad quality or deed

PROTAGONISTS.Defintion: the leading character or one of the major characters in a play, film, novel, etc

RAFT.Defintion: a small inflatable rubber or plastic boat, especially one for use in emergencies

SHEER.Defintion: nothing other than; unmitigated (used for emphasis)

SQUADRON.Defintion: an operational unit in an air force consisting of two or more flights of aircraft and the personnel required to fly them

TIDES.Defintion: the alternate rising and falling of the sea, usually twice in each lunar day at a particular place, due to the attraction of the moon and sun

WRIGGLE.Defintion: twist and turn with quick writhing movements, in this case to get out of something
